abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Alto Solimoes Basic
            Services and Sustainable Development Project for Brazil is
            to: (i) raise incomes, (ii) increase access to potable water
            and basic sanitation; and (iii) improve health outcomes. The
            Alto-Solimoes region is located in the far western part of
            the State of Amazonas bordering Colombia and Peru. It covers
            nine municipalities, and is accessible only by air and
            river, which creates unusual logistical and implementation
            challenges. The reallocation consists in increasing the
            amount allocated to categories one (works) and two (goods)
            and reducing categories three (consultants services), four
            (training), five (incremental operating costs) and ten
            (unallocated). The total amount proposed for reallocation is
            US$6,605,890.  The reasons for the reallocation provided by
            the borrower are: (a) exchange rate devaluation; (b)
            prioritization of works over consultants' services; and
            (c) planned training activities will be now financed by the Government.
